s.text: The Wall Street Journal 's main "Politics and Policy" piece states that based on recent White House performances, "the Clinton legal team clearly is calling the shots in the Lewinsky flap, and its strategy is simple: the less said, the better."
The death of McDougal on Sunday, of a heart attack in the prison where he was serving his Whitewater sentence, is widely viewed as trouble for Ken Starr.
The paper's quotes this gender- and religion-confused defense of Currie offered by Jesse Jackson: "Betty Currie isn't a lone gunman shooting from the hips.
Seems ol' Bill had a chance hook-up with her in D.C.'s posh Cosmos Club: "The dark-eyed young woman looked attractive in a simple short black dress and black stockings.

The Post says there is a McDougal book on the way titled "Arkansas Mischief."
